title: Anneal
description: Annealing is the opposite of denaturing. During annealing, two strands bind to each other using antiparallel complementary base pairing (A-T, C-G).

title: Buffer
description: Is also added to ensure that the enzyme is functional. The buffer solution contains magnesium and potassium ions and maintains a stable pH for the reaction.

title: Deoxyribonucleoside triphosphates (dNTP)
description: The building blocks used to make a deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) molecule.

title: Elongate
description: The elongation phase of PCR is when a DNA polymerase synthesizes a new DNA molecule by connecting nucleotides that are complementary to the template strand.

title: Amplify
description: To make more copies.

title: Gene
description: A gene is a short segment of double-stranded DNA that contains the instructions to make a particular protein or a functional RNA molecule (such as a transfer RNA, or tRNA molecule).

title: DNA
description: Deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) is a biological molecule whose primary role is the storage of genetic information. DNA is made of deoxyribonucleotides. The nitrogenous bases found in DNA include adenine (A), guanine (G), cytosine (C), and thymine (T).

title: Isolate
description: To separate the gene we want to study from all the other genes in a cell. In a cell, each gene can be influenced by many other genes, so to study the function of a particular gene, we often need to isolate it from all the others.

title: Polymerase chain reaction (PCR)
description: Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) is a process to help us understand things: genes, proteins, but most importantly ourselves as humans. It is a chain reaction as the three steps, denaturing, annealing, and extending, repeat themselves in a cycle. Polymerase refers to the enzyme used in the reactions.

title: Primers
description: Small DNA molecules that are complementary to either end of the area you want to copy. They serve as a starting point for a DNA polymerase.

title: Primers
description: Small DNA molecules that are complementary to either end of the area you want to copy. They serve as a starting point for a DNA polymerase.

title: Control tube
description:
Positive and negative control tubes are reactions with a known outcome that are used as a reference for comparison against the experimental sample. They can help determine that the reagents are working correctly and there has been no contamination

Control 1 = Positive control: normal, full length, Gene X

Control 2 = Positive control: mutated, shorter, Gene

Control 3 = Negative control: no DNA template

Control 4 = Negative control: prokaryotic DNA template

title: Denature
description: Unfold or unwind. In the case of DNA, denaturing describes the two strands of a double helix separating from each other. In the cell, enzymes denature DNA. In a PCR reaction, high temperatures are used to denature DNA.

title: DNA polymerase
description: An enzyme that connects dNTPs to make a DNA molecule by forming covalent bonds. Taq polymerase is a special DNA polymerase enzyme that functions at high temperatures.

title: DNA polymerase
description: An enzyme that connects dNTPs to make a DNA molecule by forming covalent bonds. Taq polymerase is a special DNA polymerase enzyme that functions at high temperatures.

title: Positive control
description: A positive control is a sample in an experiment that produces a known positive result to compare with the test sample after the same treatment. It is used to confirm that all your reagents worked as expected.

title: Negative Control
description: A negative control is the opposite of the positive control; the negative control verifies that no response is produced when none is expected after the same treatment. This can help to confirm there was no contamination of your samples.

title: P2 Micropipette
description: Used to draw up and dispense volumes of liquid between 0.2 and 2 microliters.

title: P20 Micropipette
description: Used to draw up and dispense volumes of liquid between 2 and 20 microliters.

title: P200 Micropipette
description: Used to draw up and dispense volumes of liquid between 20 and 200 microliters.

title: P1000 Micropipette
description: Used to draw up and dispense volumes of liquid between 200 and 1000 microliters.

title: P2 Tip Box
description: Filled with P2 tips. Tips are attached to the micropipette and discarded after single use to avoid contamination between transfers.

title: P20 Tip Box
description: Filled with P20 tips. Tips are attached to the micropipette and discarded after single use to avoid contamination between transfers.

title: P200 Tip Box
description: Filled with P200 tips. Tips are attached to the micropipette and discarded after single use to avoid contamination between transfers.

title: P1000 Tip Box
description: Filled with P1000 tips. Tips are attached to the micropipette and discarded after single use to avoid contamination between transfers.

title: Biohazardous Waste
description: Filled with P1000 tips. Used to dispose of any biohazardous waste resulting from the experiment, including micropipette tips.

title: Thermocycler
description: Programmable machine used to cycle tubes at specific temperatures for specific periods of time.
